bow: rant for friend and brand new mom not sure if this is the place to post this story but am completely heart broken for family friend of mine she had beautiful baby girl last week she has also been having difficulty breastfeeding the lactation consultant in the hospital she was at apparently told her it was normal after section to have delay with milk coming in but that her colostrum was enough which coukd be true for some they also refused to give the baby formula she grew bit concerned at how fussy her baby was but again was told she was fine being fussy is normal little weight loss is normal oh and do forget to just keep latching and do not use any formula the next day they discharged them to go home she said she was still struggling with feeding and felt baby was getting enough but carried on since everyone told her it was normal and fine that night they went to the er with floppy baby and discovered she was extremely dehydrated the er doc started her on formula right away and immediately asked for where she eas discharged from and said they needed to file complaint the baby is completely fine but can not stop thinking about the whole situation my heart breaks that she now has the memory of seeing her daughter like that at what point do we stop and recognize there might just be toxic mindset around baby friendly hospitals or at least certain staff even got side eyed from an lc when signed to have my baby supplemented you know breastmilk is better pretty sure fed is better than nothing if having issues thanks why do these lactation consultants seem to always be rude and dismissive why are brand new moms getting better support instead of having their concerns brushed off had this issue too as soon as we left hospital started to supplement my be by with formula and the fussing stopped but already knew the signs as it was our second baby friendly hospitals are not always that baby friendly they insist on breastfeeding even though sometimes it does work it boggles my mind know that she and baby are fine now but it just wo leave my brain is it like requirement that to be baby friendly people just be rude and dismissive to new parents she did file complaint and the er doc did as well which is good maybe someone will pay attention fed is best removed glad she was told to file complaint die hard lactation consultants are the worst the very first thing my lactation consultant did was give my baby some formula after asking me obviously because hungry babies do learn well it hard to teach baby to latch when they re screaming because they re hangry fed is best formula wo kill your breastfeeding if it not working feed the baby and try again later when everyone is calmer it ll be ok had this issue with my first was totally shamed while in the hospital with my preemie who wasn able to latch period we were feeding by syringe and he was still failing to thrive wanted to breastfeed so badly but knowing my milk supply was suffering as they didn offer pump really underequiped hospital in small town nicu wasn able to produce enough and decided that fed was better than not got 100 attitude about wanting bottle and to feed formula it was rude and really discouraging the way we were treated for worrying about the welfare of our child my heart goes out to all the moms that have to make that hard choice and get an attitude from workers about it no matter what tried to remember that was his mom and what thought was best was what was right really sorry your friend had to see her baby like that totally not ok had this issue with my first at the hospital kept telling them something was wrong they would give my son gas drops and he would quit crying but kept telling them he was eating they continued to dismiss me and finally just discharged us week later had an appointment with an independent lactation consultant who took my concerns seriously she weighed him and he had lost over pound in week and was on the brink of dehydration she had me give him formula while pumping to get him fed and she told me that whether he breastfed or not that at least he was eating so pumped for him and supplemented formula when needed am so sorry that happened to you it really gets my goat how new mothers or parents of any kind at the hospital are treated so sorry that you also had to fight for your little one aside from me being rude to the consultant another set of friends had to sneak forumla into the hospital bc one of their nurses had thrown it in the trash wtf the more hear how common this is the more horrified am glad the er doc took the time to sit with them and do it he probably gave them some nice verabge that will get their complaint noticed along with being told that he himself was also going to speak with the director of the unit they were in idk where all these culty lcs come from but they need to be fired my first one scoffed qhen chose supplementing and second one in the nicu asked why when my child was on ventilator was producing 60oz day like wow thanks for making me somehow feel worse while my baby fights to breathe our baby pediatrician came to visit every day we were in the hospital post section she told me if she was fussing and seemed hungry to ask the nurses for formula it was not offered it was the best advice could have gotten breastfeeding never worked for us we did mix for few months but then switched to formula exclusively and getting that permission from her doctor was huge for me heartbreaking we went through something similar though our baby was not quite as dehydrated for going to be prepared with some formula this is routine practice in the uk colostrum is usually enough for the first couple of days we are encouraged to latch and feed on demand so the milk catches up know it might sound controversial to many but it actually pretty normal the floppy baby is unusual sure it doesn help your friend much but it works in thousands of babies born in the uk sure the team meant no harm it different with sections when you give birth naturally especially if labor started on its own your body is ready to produce milk colostrum is fine and the baby sucking will make the milk start coming in quickly with sections several studies show that it takes much longer for the milk to start coming in and it normal practice at hospitals to bottle feed infants after sections for the first couple of days sure there are studies but we don offer formula in the uk if mums want to breastfeed we encourage latch latch latch sure it doesn work for everyone here either but just wanted to say that doubt it was done due to overly pro breastfeeding doctors maybe they should of told mum what to look out for incase supplementation was needed their lack of support was bit disappointing that insane delivered at baby friendly hospital and every single nurse lc made sure was on board with ebf and helped to make that happen they were equally supportive of my friend who was formula feeding ugh hate lcs like this they give breastfeeding and lcs bad name my lc was great and she was fully supportive of making sure the baby was fed first didn struggle with having enough milk but my son wasn able to latch due to severe tongue tie so pumped and bottle fed but she had plenty of clients that would supplement while they worked on breastfeeding had section and my milk was maybe day late even with colostrum my baby lost more than docs were comfortable with they suggested supplementing with formula so we did and you know what milk still came in baby still breastfed eventually and she didn starve or get sick because of hysteria surrounding formula she healthy and happy year old now thousands maybe millions of babies thrive on formula sure do think breast milk is better for babies but being fed at all is ultimately what is best also mamas need to follow their instincts whenever my gut has disagreed with doctor not very often but two times that really stand out my gut has been right mama knows best my baby had no issues at birth besides jaundice and never produced 60 ounces day also would never choose breastfeeding again it made my ppd worse and was killing myself trying to do something that wasn working for us bless your lactation consultant exactly yea the nurse that was in the room with us was absolutely disgusted and had the lc removed she sat with me while just tried not to cry and ended up helping me with pumping more and later with latching baby never saw that lc in the nicu after that wonder if she was reprimanded that awful maybe it was different because have twins but they just brought me bottles of donated breast milk while was in the hospital and gave us samples of formula to take home with us and told us exactly what formula we needed to buy until they reached certain stage never could breast feed tried pumping for months babies got about 50 50 mix of formula and breast milk and decided it was too much for me and stopped the only guilt ever felt came from myself your friend should absolutely file complaint at the very least that bs am so sorry for your friend too had csection and my little guy had hard time latching the lactation consultant came by but did not offer formula my husband had to ask for it multiple times the nurses came by and would assist with latching advice and placement not once was formula offered to me he had to go out of his way to ask he only knew to ask because he has son whose mother adamantly refused to breastfeed from the get go new mom exhausted and overwhelmed didn think to ask for formula ashamed to admit didn consider that as an option if it hadn been for him might have just gone along with it and could have ended up like your friend completely certain this isn true it took me like minutes of googling to find several stories by section moms in the uk that were offered formula for their babies if the infants seemed too lethargic or if the milk took too much time to come in here just one example https www breastfeedingnetwork org uk breastfeeding after caesarean birth where the mother chose to express milk by hand but formula was evidently offered lethargic post section baby isn something to just brush off this is ridiculous have had the best help with lc until my last baby months ago but nothing along the lines of this but also remember you can ask for different consultant because everyone has different ideas and ways to help that particular consultant that helped your friend hope was severely reprimanded think you misunderstood yes if the baby isn well of course but it not routinely offered just because the mother had section so telling mum that colostrum is enough isn abnormal this is absolutely true had section at 37 weeks due to pre eclampsia also has gestational diabetes it took probably days for my milk to come in and that was with constant pumping and feeding the nurses and lc assured me that was doing everything right but the circumstances were causing me to have delay am so sorry for your friend and her experience baby friendly hospitals are almost always synonym for mom hostile had made clear with my ob gyn team before birth that was planning to formula feed had an emergency induction at 34 weeks and everyone spoke to after birth just pretty much ignored my wishes and asked again and again when would like to start pumping didn know baby needed my milk in the nicu mean of course knew that and would have happily changed my mind but god the condescension and judgment sucked so guiltily ended up pumping and breastfeeding for the next months but had little support and switched to exclusive formula feeding which was shamed for there is no winning when it comes to feeding so don give damn about anyone but baby plan to breastfeed this next baby but know much much better now how to navigate the hellish lcs and doc visits it sucks as pediatrician am so tired of the breast is best mindset myself breastfed all kids but one of them was supplemented for jaundice shudder to think that baby friendly hospital might not have allowed her to be supplemented your friend recognized there was an issue and brought her baby in am so sorry she had to go through this hope she is getting all the support she needs had an lc who just did help me at all breastfeeding worked in the hospital with shield once or twice but once got home it did not work at all thankfully both my mom amp mil were super supportive and got me formula to help until could figure things out never got things figured out with that one and when saw the lc she was just like here some formula no help with anything nursing the next time delivered they had replaced the lc with great lady who figured out what was wrong and how to get it fixed had great nursing journey for my younger two but she also made sure had formula ready in case things did work there good and bad on both ends they just **really** need to know wtf they re talking about way too many stories like your friends removed when gave birth in may one of the nurses told me they do do formula here demanded formula produce milk for the first couple of days because lost liter of blood was going to let my kid go hungry shame on that hospital removed meant no harm and did no harm are very different they clearly weren recognizing that it wasn working for this baby or this mom and ignored signs they shouldn have because they the team not the mom were making decision for the baby they pressured vulnerable mom to do something with her baby and gave her advice that was wrong it doesn matter that it okay for thousands of others there are plenty of babies it doesn work for it great **if** baby is getting enough colostrum clearly if baby if dehydrated that fast baby is not getting anything my milk took nearly days with vaginal delivery my baby was really grizzly but my milk came eventually don want to offend was just offering an explanation why the doctors reassured the mum it was normal however they forget to give the additional info re what to do if baby remains unfed they refused formula when the mom did notice the signs why would they tell her what to look for she knew she did that they refused to feed her kid and told her it was fine them ignoring the signs and encouraging mom to could ve killed her just giving the benefit of doubt not saying it was the right thing but doubt it was with bad intentions not sure why this has got so heated imo the breast is best mindset is toxic glad the baby is ok and that they decided to go to hospital in time yes clearly but risk it the advice was probably given with the best intentions clearly they didn give the full picture it not an argument but just common advice in the uk ok well disagree fussy baby does not mean they need formula plus op is defending her poor friend the information is secondhand don want to fight this is not what came here for they refused formula stops defending that not sure they can mum can advocate for their child no healthcare professional would chose to harm baby ve read stories like this where mom was having issues bf and nurses and hospital workers just brushed it off and figured *eventually* baby will get the hang of it allowing the baby to starve since they were unsuccessfully attempting nurse if my baby doesn get the hang of nursing in the first few hours ll gladly supplement was having trouble with my second because she would constantly fall asleep once she latch for only half minute they quite literally gave me the options of pumping my own and bottle feeding using donor milk or formula that outrageous my daughter was fed formula by the nicu nurses in our hospital because we both had complications which made it difficult to even attempt breastfeeding until we were out of the hospital and they are amazing angels who do what is necessary to keep baby happy and healthy however in the breastfeeding class went to when was still pregnant asked how the hospital addressed babies that had hard time latching and if formula was provided or if it is better to bring some to prepare if necessary and the teacher did even want to answer my questions she basically made it seem like issues are super rare and you just pop the baby on and everything works like magic also saw multiple lcs and they all were like just keep trying just keep trying well my baby never figured it out and we spent every time we tried screaming and crying and fighting each other even though there was plenty of milk coming out she just did get it at two months we switched to 100 bottles and ep and ignored the judgement and never looked back the mentality your friend experienced is so absolutely toxic to the mental health of new mothers and obviously in her case the health of the baby fed is best period my staff was unhelpful the opposite way wanted to breastfeed and was having no more trouble than is normal but toward the end of my stay got multiple people saying do you want to try other options just because baby and were still learning and they were all concerned about us wish hospital staff were better trained at paying attention to the needs and desires of mom and the needs of her baby my son was born with heart defect and while waiting for surgery his heart rate would sky rocket to dangerous numbers when we would try to breast feed stopped making him try and they gave him whatever pumped mixed with formula until no more milk came in the bottle was just easier for him to use so sure formula saved his life he bigger and stronger than most babies with specific defect because of his ability to eat there should be no shame associated with giving your baby the nutrition they need to live ve had my share of bad experiences think they need to fix the whole do or die mentality formula can work with breastfeeding until my milk came in with my 4th just few days ago supplemented and now not supplementing at all yeah it the same everywhere unfortunately hope something comes out if their complaint maybe they will look at it differently in the er in the future something similar happened to me and my baby in our case the breakdown is because you re discharged for vaginal birth before milk comes in anyway he has weak suck and needs to use bottle but we didn know it at the time and we intended to ebf the day after we were discharged from the hospital realized he had been sleeping more than might be normal and that his diaper count was insufficient thank god we were tracking he was admitted to the hospital with hypernatremic dehydration and temperature of 95 gave him bottle of formula before we left for the hospital and think in part that why it wasn worse glad had some and encourage every expecting mom to buy box of those nursette bottles just in case if you don need it awesome but if you do you won want to delay he spent the night on iv fluids and glucose and was fed formula started pumping luckily we seem to have caught it just in time and he doing well at two months ve been pumping but in the process of quitting because exclusive pumping is horror show major props to those who do it for an extended time he ll be on formula after that and so thankful it exists this post says they did believe the mom or don but stop defending it was livid so when had my second did allow anybody to ignore me or try to shush me it was so bad that my family grandmother and aunts were making me feel like an overprotective first time mom but my mom just told me baby you know what going on with your child so just push until someone listens wtf why are they so crazy preach baby friendly can turn to baby and momma toxic sadly heard lot of stories like this one trust your gut moms have you considered that god may have been calling that poor girl to him and by feeding her that manufactured concoction called formula you denied his wishes it was lc that finally convinced me that breast feeding isn right for everyone when she could see that was clearly struggling with ppa my son didn gain any weight between weeks old even though he was eating ton exclusively pumped bc of his tongue tie when mentioned oh that what he weighed at his week check up not knowing that he should have gain at least few ounces she helped me call his ped for weight follow up then my own doc for the ppa her reassurance that happy mom is what my son really needed was exactly what needed to hear even with my own husband and family telling me formula was ok to give him her saying it lifted that pressure from my shoulder this almost happened to us he didn get so dehydrated he was floppy but he was definitely heading in that direction he also had jaundice and had to be admitted it was freaking horrible and you know what all that stress prevented me from having letdown and was engorged but nothing came out my milk never recovered after that the stupid bfhi initiative lead to breastfeeding failure for me think it better here in the uk the hospital would let me leave until could show properly latched multiple times and one midwife actually said to me if you said you were going to give your baby formula have signed you off by now but you want to purely breastfeed and you have got the hang of it formula would have been fine but because said wanted to bf only they did want to let me go until knew how the support while was crying cause could do it was amazing ugh so sorry that they had to go through that didn want to breastfeed after the first day because was in bad mental state and felt more comfortable with formula everyone even the nurses and doctors told me had to breastfeed while was in the hospital they would grab me and force me to do so it was the worst experience of my life and think cried for three days straight while was in there hope no moms have to go through what did and this story breaks my heart hope everything works out for them and the complaint makes difference in the way the hospital does things this happened to me minus the er visit but did know enough at the time to understand what happened only now that ve given birth times do look back to the birth of my first child and realize that he literally was not getting anything for good 48 hours was induced so it took much longer for my milk to come in we had no idea that newborns had to eat every couple of hours so when our baby slept hours night we just thought we gotten lucky took him to his first checkup couple of days after he was born and everyone flipped he lost ton of weight and was hard to wake up we spent the next week using cold washcloths on him every hours just to wake him up enough so he would feed in retrospect it terrifying it entirely possible he could have just gone to sleep and never woken up in those first days the lactation folks and nurses at the hospital told me nothing and were completely unconcerned ll also add that if nurse refuses to provide formula after asking ask for another nurse when had my first would breastfeed then after that attempt top up with formula or whatever pumped milk had now they recommend feeding with formula bottle breast milk first then going to the breast as babies are calmer and able to latch better hungry babies don learn well indeed because babies have literally died look up the fed is bet foundation and read jillian johnson story there is so little acknowledgment of the fact that breastfeeding doesn always work formula was originally invented for reason plus you can complement with formula and not put the latch at risk by giving it through cup sure it is messier but if you really want to breastfeed and having issues it is possible also nothing happens if you can do it at the end what matters is healthy baby really want to breastfeed but if for some reason it doesn become possibility also open to formula have my dream mom baby experience that would be awesome to achieve but at the end having healthy family is what matters to me the sad part of this story is that the lc clearly didn do her job correctly at all and the poor mom believed her because she the expert she must feel awful as someone who gave birth in the uk and chose to formula feed was personally offended by the huge push to breastfeed there know that my situation is different because it was an issue with milk production but my point is that it irrelevant anyway educate mom on both ways to feed and let mom choose the end the push to breastfeed in first world countries where we have access to clean water is just getting absolutely ridiculous the entire movement is positively riddled with lies and misinformation moms body moms choice stop trying to defend this movement plus there really good formulas out there my biggest reasons for wanting to breastfeed are because of the bonding experience and that breastfeeding is way more budget friendly cousin had kids managed to breastfeed all imagine all that formula but even if there are health advantages to breast milk formula isn bad at all at the end you obtain healthy baby either way and that what matters am shocked that most new mother do realize they can supplement with formula and still breastfeed what they can always wanted to breastfeed but am strong believer in fed is best my baby got both and still get the joy and satisfaction of breastfeeding we made sure we had bottles beforehand that resembled nipples as best as possible to try and avoid confusion and frustration had no problems going back and forth can stand those elitist lcs and parents who act like they re so above people because they breastfeed ultimately we all want to have happy thriving children why do people feel the need to judge others for how they get there removed idk if my friend realized she could have brought her own formula to the hospital but the story got was one nurse brought it and another tossed it for some reason either way rude yes pumped like an idiot to get my milk to come in after my csection and post partum nurse frowned at me and said you better not get your baby used to bottle so he can take to the breast like fucccckkkk you my son did eat at all the first or 2nd night until broke down and gave him bottle of formula so disappointed about the toxic culture surrounding breastfeeding breast feeding is great but it not the be all end all of motherhood so sorry that happened with your first was also induced and my baby would wake every hour for food but then was knocked out that night my ob told me her sugar levels were fine and it sometimes normal for newborns to sleep through their first night bc they had long day too lol what happened with my friend though is that her baby was constantly fussing and she was just told to keep latching her when she asked for formula one nurse brought it but apparently different one tossed it because when she woke up again it was nowhere to be found she also felt ashamed for needing it which is all sorts of wrong not sure what her pediatrician situation at the hospital was but she is switching baby doctor so sorry you experienced that from what was told the rr doc helped them make complaint and then also said the fact the er doc helped them file it plus made his own call to the director of the maternity ward helps no one deserves to feel bad about wanting to feed their baby and then having the horrivle
